SageMaker Data Wrangler.description: Data Preparation, Transformation, and feature engineering Tool with a single interface for data selection, cleaning, exploration, visualization, and processing. It includes SQL support for data queries and data quality tools to analyze data quality.

SageMaker Model Cards.description: A feature of SageMaker to record information about ML models, including training details, evaluation metrics, and model performance.

SageMaker Canvas.description: A tool for building ML models without needing to write any code. It does not have models for content moderation.

Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth.description: A service that uses a human workforce to create accurate labels for data used to train models. It does not store model training and performance information for audit purposes.

SageMaker Model Monitor.description: An automated alert system that detects model quality issues, such as data drift and anomalies. It ensures model performance remains stable over time.

SageMaker Studio.description: An integrated development environment (IDE) for building machine learning models, including JupyterLab, RStudio, and Visual Studio Code.

Guardrails for Amazon Bedrock.description: Evaluates user inputs and foundation model responses based on specific policies, providing safeguards regardless of the underlying foundation model.

Amazon Rekognition.description: A fully managed AI service for image and video analysis. It can identify inappropriate content in images, including drawings, paintings, and animations.

AWS Artifact.description: An audit resource providing on-demand access to AWS security and compliance documentation.

AWS CloudTrail.description: A service that tracks user activity and API usage on AWS for audit purposes. It records actions taken by users, roles, and services in an AWS account.

Amazon CloudWatch.description: A centralized logging service for monitoring AWS resources, application logs, and performance metrics.

AWS Trusted Advisor.description: Provides recommendations for cost optimization, security, and resilience. Evaluates an AWS environment and offers actions to align with best practices.

Amazon Macie.description: Uses machine learning to discover, monitor, and protect sensitive data in Amazon S3. It helps comply with data governance and privacy regulations.

AWS Config.description: Tracks configurations of AWS resources, identifying settings that don’t meet compliance standards, like a publicly accessible S3 bucket.

Amazon DocumentDB.description: A fully managed, native JSON document database supporting vector search. Can store, index, and search millions of vectors with millisecond response times.

Amazon OpenSearch Service.description: A fully managed service to deploy, scale, and operate OpenSearch. It supports high query throughput and use cases like semantic search and recommendation engines.

SageMaker Clarify.description: A tool in SageMaker for explaining model predictions and assessing bias in datasets. Includes tools for foundation model evaluation, comparing quality and responsibility metrics.

SageMaker JumpStart.description: A hub for pre-trained models but does not allow user models to be added.

SageMaker Model Registry.description: A managed catalog for machine learning models, allowing management of model versions and metadata.

Embeddings.description: Vector representations of content that capture semantic relationships, enabling similar content to have close vector representations.

Amazon Inspector.description: A vulnerability management service that scans EC2 workloads for software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure.

Amazon Comprehend.description: An NLP service for extracting insights from documents, like entities, key phrases, sentiment, and syntax.

Amazon Textract.description: Extracts text from documents, including handwritten text.

Amazon Kendra.description: An intelligent search service that uses semantic understanding to provide specific answers to questions.

Amazon Q Business.description: A generative AI virtual assistant for answering questions, summarizing, and generating content, based on provided data.

Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG).description: Optimizes the output of large language models by referencing authoritative knowledge bases outside their training data.

Fine Tuning.description: Further training a pre-trained model on specific tasks to improve accuracy, specificity, and reduce bias.

Continued Pre-Training.description: Ongoing training using unlabeled, industry-specific data.

Transfer Learning.description: A method of using a model developed for one task as a starting point for another.

Chain of Thought.description: A prompt technique for breaking down complex questions into smaller parts, often used in arithmetic and logical tasks.

Amazon Lex.description: A fully managed AI service for designing conversational interfaces in applications using voice and text.

Amazon Forecast.description: Predicts future points in time series data.

Amazon Fraud Detector.description: Detects fraud in online transactions, product reviews, checkouts, and payments.

Bias.description: Unfair prejudice or preference that may affect model predictions.

Overfitting.description: When a model performs well on training data but poorly on new data due to high variance.

Underfitting.description: When a model is too simple to capture patterns in data, characterized by high bias and low variance.

Explainability.description: Understanding how a model makes predictions in human terms, useful for interpreting model decisions.

Generative AI Model.description: AI models that produce novel, human-like outputs based on their training data.

ROUGE.description: Metric used to evaluate text summarization and machine translation quality, emphasizing recall.

BLEU.description: A precision-based metric for evaluating machine-translated text quality.

Top K.description: Limits the selection of tokens in language models to the K most probable options for controlled diversity.

Top P.description: Limits word choice in language models based on the probability distribution to ensure coherent outputs.

Temperature.description: Controls the randomness in model output. Higher values yield more diverse responses; lower values make output more deterministic.

F1.description: Metric that combines precision and recall for evaluating classification models.

BERTScore.description: Metric using pretrained contextual embeddings to evaluate semantic similarity between generated and reference text.

Semantic Robustness.description: Measures how small input changes affect model output consistency.

Perplexity.description: Measures how well a language model predicts a test set, with lower values indicating better predictions.

Accuracy.description: The percentage of correct predictions in a classification model.

Precision.description: The proportion of true positives among all positive predictions.

Recall.description: The proportion of true positives among all actual positives.

False Positive Rate.description: The proportion of false positives among all negative instances.

AUC-ROC.description: A plot of recall against false positive rate; scores closer to 1 indicate better accuracy.

Mean Squared Error (MSE).description: The average squared difference between predicted and actual values, used in regression model evaluation.

R Squared (R2).description: Percentage of variance explained by a model, indicating its predictive power.

Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE).description: The square root of MSE, indicating the presence of large errors or outliers in model predictions.

Amazon Bedrock.description: A fully managed service for accessing and customizing foundation models for applications.

Low Bias and Low Variance.description: Ideal outcome in model training with minimal assumptions and noise.

Overfitting (Low Bias, High Variance).description: Model captures noise, performing poorly on new data.

Underfitting (High Bias, Low Variance).description: Model misses patterns in data, leading to poor predictions.

Hallucination.description: AI response that isn't justified by training data.

Gen AI Architectures.description: Include GANs, VAEs, Transformers, and Diffusion Models.

GAN.description: A neural network architecture where two networks compete to improve content generation.

VAE.description: A deep learning algorithm for generating content, anomaly detection, and noise removal.

Transformers.description: A neural network architecture that learns context in sequence data.

AWS Audit Manager.description: Helps simplify compliance assessments by continually auditing AWS usage.

SageMaker Inference.description: Provides options like real-time, batch, serverless, and asynchronous inference for model deployment.

AWS AI Service Cards.description: Resource to help customers understand AWS AI services better.

Amazon SageMaker Debugger.description: Monitors and profiles model training jobs to optimize model performance.

Amazon Augmented AI (Amazon A2I).description: Creates workflows for human review of ML model predictions.

Amazon SageMaker Autopilot.description: Provides insights into model predictions using tools from SageMaker Clarify.

Epoch.description: A single pass through the entire dataset in training.

AWS PrivateLink.description: Provides private connectivity between VPCs and AWS services without using the public internet.

Learning Rate.description: Controls the speed at which model parameters are updated during training, affecting convergence stability.

Supervised Learning.description: Training a model on labeled data to learn input-output mappings.

Unsupervised Learning.description: Model training on unlabeled data to discover patterns or clusters.

Semi-Supervised Learning.description: A hybrid approach using both labeled and unlabeled data for training.

Stop Sequences.description: Tokens that instruct a model to cease text generation, ensuring structured responses.

Intelligent Document Processing (IDP).description: Automates data extraction from paper-based documents for digital processes.

Feature Extraction.description: Technique to create new features from raw data, useful for unstructured data like images or text.

Feature Selection.description: Selecting the most relevant features for modeling, reducing complexity.

Multi-Class Classification.description: A classification task with three or more classes, where each instance is assigned to one class.

Multi-Label Classification.description: Allows each instance to be associated with multiple classes simultaneously.

Amazon Bedrock Custom Model Import.description: Enables importing custom models to Bedrock for seamless use.

Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases.description: Provides context to foundation models using private data for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
